OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Custom organization with options ‘Allow Organization Tasks’ = Yes and ‘Position Assignment Unique’ = No

validation.validation: The entered Organization must be a custom organization whose organization type is configured with options: ‘Allow Organization Tasks’ = Yes and ‘Position Assignment Unique’ = No.

ReorganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assign_Members_to_Custom_Organization_Da.description: Reorganization determines the effective date that positions are added as a member

Position_ElementObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Position_ElementObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Position_ElementObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assign_Members_to_Custom_Organization_Da.description: The position or position restriction you want to add to the custom organization. For position restrictions, Workday uses the reorganization effective date to determine the position. When a position restriction has job overlap as of the reorganization effective date, Workday assigns membership to the principal and overlap positions. If the position is unavailable or unfilled as of the date you view the custom organization it's assigned to, Workday doesn't display it.

Position_ElementObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Position_ElementObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Position_ElementObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assign_Members_to_Custom_Organization_Da.description: Positions to be removed from the custom organization. Positions that are not members of the custom organization as of the reorganization effective date will be ignored.

Membership_RuleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Membership_RuleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Membership_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assign_Members_to_Custom_Organization_Da.description: Optional. The reference ID of an existing membership rule. For positions that match the rule criteria as of the reorganization effective date, this operation explicitly adds them as members of the custom organization.You must have access to membership rules to be able to specify a membership rule.This field is available as of v37.2

If true, this operation removes all members as of the reorganization effective date, including positions that are not currently members.This operation has no impact on membership based on dynamic or semi-dynamic rules that are linked to the custom organization.The default is false. This field is available as of v37.2

description: Sub element of the request having positions to add/remove.
